ansi wrote:

>>We have yet to do a windows start script.  Technically its an
>>unsupported platform but it seems like experience has it that it
>>generally works for people.  If anyone wants to donate a windows start
>>script, I can add it in.
>>    
>>
>hi,stack
>pls check if this script match your purpos.
>  
>
Thank you Ansi for the donation.

See below for a few questions.

>-------------------------------------------------------
>@rem *************************************************************************
>@rem This script is used to start Heritrix.
>@rem
>@rem This script sets the following variables before starting Heritrix:
>@rem
>@rem HERITRIX_HOME	- The root directory of your Heritrix installation
>@rem JAVA_HOME  - Location of the version of Java used to start Heritrix. 
>@rem              This variable must point to the root directory of a 
>@rem              JDK installation.
>@rem CLASSPATH  - Adds the JDK and Heritrix jars to the classpath.  
>@rem *************************************************************************
>
>@echo off
>
>set HERITRIX_HOME=..
>set JAVA_HOME=
>
>@rem Check that the Heritrix classes are where we expect them to be
>:checkHeritrix
>if exist "%HERITRIX_HOME%\heritrix.jar" goto checkJava
>  
>
The heritrix..jar is often named heritrix-1.1.0.jar or 
heritrix-1.1.0-2004101010.jar.  Can the above check be more 
generalized?  Is it ok to put a wildcard into the filename.

>echo The heritrix.jar wasn't found in directory %HERITRIX_HOME%.
>echo Please edit your script so that the HERITRIX_HOME variable points 
>echo to the Heritrix installation directory.
>goto finish
>
>@rem Check that java is where we expect it to be
>:checkJava
>if exist "%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java.exe" goto runHeritrix
>echo The JDK wasn't found in directory %JAVA_HOME%.
>echo Please edit your script so that the JAVA_HOME variable 
>echo points to the location of your JDK.
>goto finish
>
>  
>
Is it possible for the script to pick up a JAVA_HOME environment variable?

Thanks,
St.Ack

>@rem Run Heritrix
>:runHeritrix
>if exist "setEnv.bat" del setEnv.bat
>set CLASSPATH=%HERITRIX_HOME%\heritrix.jar
>for /r %HERITRIX_HOME%\lib %%a in (*.jar) do (echo set
>CLASSPATH=%%CLASSPATH%%;%%a>>setEnv.bat)
>call setEnv.bat
>
>%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java -classpath %CLASSPATH% -Xmx512m
>-Dheritrix.home=%HERITRIX_HOME% org.archive.crawler.Heritrix %1 %2 %3
>%4 %5 %6 %7 %8 %9
>
>  
>

>:finish
>-------------------------------------------------------
>Ansi
>
>
>
>
